title: Apple's AI and search executive Robby Walker to leave, Bloomberg News reports
snippet: Robby Walker, a senior executive at Apple responsible for artificial intelligence and search, is set to leave the company next month. His departure comes amid growing concerns over Apple’s slow progress in AI, including delays in its Siri upgrades and cautious rollout of its Apple Intelligence suite.

title: Apple launches slim iPhone 17 Air, new AirPods and Watch in holiday refresh
snippet: Apple has unveiled its latest lineup of products ahead of the 2025 holiday season, focusing on innovation and performance enhancements. Headlining the release is the iPhone 17 Air, the thinnest iPhone ever at 5.6mm, starting at $999. Other updates include an upgraded standard iPhone 17 as well as new Watch and AirPods models.

title: Apple debuts thinner, $999 iPhone Air at 'awe-dropping' annual product event
snippet: At its product event, Apple introduced the ultra-thin iPhone Air (5.6mm), the iPhone 17 Pro models, new AirPods Pro 3 and updates to the Apple Watch, along with health-oriented features like hypertension alerts and satellite connectivity.

title: Apple Posts Better-Than-Expected Earnings as Services Revenue Hits Record High
snippet: Apple reported $94.04B in revenue, up 10% YoY, surpassing analyst expectations. Services revenue reached an all-time high of $27.42B while iPhone and Mac sales also rose. Margins remained strong despite ongoing tariff and supply chain pressures.

title: Apple roars back with stronger-than-expected iPhone sales and record $94 billion third-quarter revenue
snippet: Revenue was driven by a 13% YoY increase in iPhone sales and a strong rebound in China; CEO Tim Cook noted growing investment in AI, with forward guidance suggesting continued strength.

title: Apple plans smart glasses launch in 2026, Bloomberg News reports
snippet: Apple is set to launch smart glasses by the end of 2026, according to Bloomberg. Prototypes are being finalized, with production expected to begin late 2025. This comes as Apple seeks new hardware categories and competitors like Meta push aggressive offerings.

title: Apple increases U.S. commitment to $600 billion, announces ambitious program
snippet: Apple raised its U.S. investment target to $600B over 4 years under its American Manufacturing Program. Efforts will focus on components, assembly, and supply chain localization in key states.

title: Apple’s iPhone Air launch hits a snag in China
snippet: The ultra-thin iPhone Air’s eSIM-only design ran into regulatory hurdles in China. The device’s preorder link was removed from China’s Apple site until clarity is obtained from authorities.

title: Slim iPhone Air could be a design win for Apple, analysts say
snippet: Apple has unveiled the iPhone Air, its thinnest smartphone yet at just 5.6 mm, aiming to revitalize its iPhone lineup with a bold design shift. Debuting alongside the iPhone 17 models, it features a titanium frame, ceramic shield glass, and A19 Pro chip. Some concern remains about battery life and single-camera limitations.

title: Apple launches slim iPhone 17 Air, new AirPods and Watch in holiday refresh
snippet: Apple unveiled a new generation of the iPhone, including a sleek model dubbed iPhone 17 Air, and several other devices, as it looks to drive upgrades and spur sales ahead of the holiday shopping season. Prices largely unchanged from last year; 128 GB option dropped.

title: Apple crushes Wall Street expectations as iPhone sales soar
snippet: Apple reported a strong fiscal third quarter for 2025, significantly outperforming Wall Street expectations. Revenue reached $94.04 billion, up nearly 10% year-over-year, with iPhone sales increasing 13.5%. Tariffs and margin pressures were cited as risks.

title: Apple revenue forecast beats estimates, tariff costs projected at $1.1 billion
snippet: Apple surpassed earnings expectations in its fiscal third-quarter revenue of $94.04 billion, while warning that U.S. tariffs would add $1.1 billion in costs for the upcoming quarter. Strong sales helped offset earlier risks.

title: Apple reports fourth quarter results of fiscal 2024
snippet: Apple posted quarterly revenue of $94.9 billion, up 6 percent year over year, and diluted earnings per share of $0.97. Excluding a one-time charge, EPS was $1.64, up 12% YoY. Services revenue reached a new high. Device sales mixed.

title: Apple beats earnings forecast despite decline in iPhone sales
snippet: Apple surpassed earnings expectations in Q3 2024 with revenues rising 4.9% to $85.78 billion, despite a decline in iPhone sales and challenges in the Chinese market. The wearables segment saw a small decline.

title: Apple targets Sept. 10 debut for new iPhones, AirPods and watches, Bloomberg News reports
snippet: Apple plans to launch its latest iPhones, watches, and AirPods on September 10, with sales beginning September 20. Analysts anticipate a strong upgrade cycle following competitive pressures especially in AI and software.
